text: Claudio Alberto Morresi (born April 30, 1962 in Buenos Aires) is a former football player from Argentina. He is currently the Sports Secretary of Argentina. ==Career== Born in Buenos Aires, Morresi formed with Enzo Francescoli one of the best striking partnerships in soccer at the River Plate football club in the early 1980s. Morresi played for Argentina at the 1981 FIFA World Youth Championship finals in Australia. ==Titles== {| class="wikitable" !Season !Club !Title |- |1985–1986|| River Plate|| Primera Division Argentina |- |1986|| River Plate|| Copa Libertadores |- |1986|| River Plate|| Copa Intercontinental |- |} ==References== ==External links== * *Profile at BDFA * Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Argentine footballers Category:Sportspeople from Buenos Aires Category:Argentine Primera División players Category:Liga MX players Category:Club Atlético Huracán footballers Category:Club Atlético River Plate footballers Category:Independiente Santa Fe footballers Category:Club Atlético Vélez Sarsfield footballers Category:Santos Laguna footballers Category:Club Atlético Platense footballers Category:Club Atlético Huracán managers Category:Argentine expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Mexico Category:Argentina under-20 international footballers Category:Argentina youth international footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Argentine football managers
title: Claudio Morresi
